intro: Testudinaria multiflora, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a popular houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Testudinaria multiflora is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
